intro: Sorocea longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed sorocea, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
